snippet: HSBC’s deal, which ended a review of its foreclosures in the United States, brought the total payout by banks to resolve related issues to $9.3 billion.
abstract: United States arm of British bank HSBC Holdings agrees to pay $249 million to end case-by-case review of past home foreclosures in US, bringing total payout by banks to resolved related issues to $9.3 billion.
lead_paragraph: HSBC’s deal, which ended a review of its foreclosures in the United States, brought the total payout by banks to resolve related issues to $9.3 billion.

headline.seo: HSBC Will Pay $249 Million to Settle Foreclosure Review Case
headline.main: HSBC to Pay $249 Million in a Foreclosure Inquiry
headline.print_headline: HSBC to Pay $249 Million In a Foreclosure Inquiry
